title: Loren D. Estleman-Adventures of Johnny Vermillion
description:
Johnny VermillionÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s theater troupe brings masterpieces to the Wild West. The four actors are versatile enough to wear many costumes and play many roles. A few props, a little makeup, a costume and--voilÃƒÂ --applause on the rugged frontier.

Johnny also arranges a special attraction for each town. While his actors bustle in and out of costumes, on and off the stage in many roles, one plays the villain in the bank. Then the actors take their curtain calls and railroad away.

Who? Us? Rob a bank? But you saw all of us on stage. When could we have done that?

A Pinkerton man becomes the troupeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s severest critic: He notices the news reports of stage performances one day and...............
